When you would rather play KSP than go to a theme park.

Edited April 17, 2017 by kerbiloid
You know you're a nerd when your current profession, your previous profession & all of your varied hobbies are summed up by one phrase: computer science.
When you don't understand why they call your computer — "science".
Brings iPad on vacation just to stay on the forums.

when pro science
when con science
when er her is story about let air may bee later
When all you want to talk about are spacecraft.

when your social life has slipped down so far that I cant even talk to anyone without them attempting to trip me in the hallway, yell at me, call me mentally disabled, or even let ME HELP THEM, all because I only want to talk about space

<EVIL VOICE ON>

but my day shall come, and when it does, my revenge will be short and sweet

<EVIL VOICE OFF>

but I still think of nerd, weird, and such as compliments! so eh...

Edited April 27, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''

When everyone else is trying to sleep, meanwhile you're up at 12:20 AM trying to solve this: 

Spoiler

That's what I'm doing right now.
When you giggled seeing any space movie and the first thing that pops up in your mind is "That's impossible according to astrophysics. KSP teached me so many things to ruin ever space movie ever"

when:

as i m very sensitive to surrounding noise and light and ...
i took the habit to remove my glass and/or close my eyes in many populated area, like metro, street, restaurant etc. mostly depending to what point i feel oppressed by a few surrunding stimuli (that's not agoraphobia, more a loud "um-comfort" from a various range of thing just floating in the air, let's just say some ondulatory phenomenom)

i even took the habit to do a few lunch eating task eyes closed, as time pass i m fairly comfy with a few basic thing now, like aiming most of the object on the table relatively quicly and without the need of searching them necessarly tactily mainly, so i introduced some long wait and extra whole body moving to reduce the "ram loc single move" aspect,  as noise/"some vibrations" are to me really often very annoyin', so today to reduce the noise nuisance will attempting to make my daily meal, i added one ear piece with mp3 music, and like usual closed my eyes for doing a few things while eating, at first with the ear piece left i miss aimed to the right eyes closed, then after a few try i readjusted, near the end of the lunch i removed the ear piece and music, and was aiming left wich i also re-corrected pretty quiclky.

interesting, tend to confirm some sort of sonar effect and 3d localisation just with the ears there a few others "experimental details" but well try it, interesting
